title: Learn the Fundamentals & Get a Camera
description: Start with any camera, even a smartphone. The most crucial step is to learn the fundamentals of composition, lighting, and the exposure triangle (Aperture, Shutter Speed, ISO). Formal education is optional; passion and practice are key.
qualifications: A basic understanding of photography/videography principles

title: Develop Technical Skills & Build a Portfolio
description: Invest in a DSLR or mirrorless camera. Master post-processing software. Build a strong portfolio by practicing in a specific niche you enjoy, such as portraits, weddings, products, or events.
qualifications: A strong portfolio in a chosen niche
skills: Adobe Premiere Pro & DaVinci Resolve (for video)

title: Assistant Photographer/Videographer or Freelancer
description: Gain professional experience by assisting an established photographer or videographer. This is the best way to learn the business side and how to work on a professional set. Alternatively, start taking on small paid freelance projects like small events or portrait sessions.
salaryRangeLKR: LKR 40,000 - 80,000 (as an assistant or from small gigs)
institutes: Assisting well-known wedding, commercial, or fashion photographers

title: Professional Photographer/Videographer
description: Go full-time as a professional. You will be responsible for marketing yourself, finding clients, planning shoots, executing the creative vision, and delivering the final edited product. Specializing in a high-demand area like wedding photography or commercial videography is common.
qualifications: A professional website and social media presence

title: Own a Studio / Production House
description: Scale your business by opening your own studio for portrait or product work, or by starting a production house. This involves hiring other photographers, editors, and building a team to handle larger commercial projects for corporate clients.
qualifications: A strong brand and client base
